channel.title: Unreal Tournament
channel.description: Discussion relating to the newly announced "Unreal Tournament" (aka UT4), a crowdsourced and community driven, brand new entry in the Unreal Tournament series. (Epic will be reading this forum for suggestions)

Code:

item.title: UT99 SP ladder with replaced weapons?
item.author: invalid@example.com (Ironword300)
item.dc:creator: Ironword300
item.content:encoded:
Hi, after long time of not playing UT(99, as I find it's now being called)--a very, very, veeeery long time--I'm firing up the old girl once again. I'm going to play the original Unreal SP campaign with the newest Infiltration weapons (they have an M60 machine gun now w/s3tc-quality texture--wow!). But I also want to go to the total opposite extreme and get wild with Nali Weapons 3. But I only want to do that in UT itself, not UnrealSP. Somehow NW3 just seems a little too futuristic for the...

UT99 SP ladder with replaced weapons?

item.title: Future of the franchise?
item.author: invalid@example.com (ZeaLitY)
item.dc:creator: ZeaLitY
item.content:encoded:
I can't believe IT will be 20 years old in just 4 short years. Right now, UT4 has 86 players online, while the original UT has 159. (Some of those may be fake bots designed to lure in players, of course.)

Is there a future for this style of play anymore? I felt like the original UT, for me, captured a few unique things:
  • A futuristic aesthetic
  • Very tight, fluid gameplay
  • Dynamic range of motion (through dodging, crouching, boost-jumping off movers, etc...this enabled the...

Future of the franchise?

item.title: Inf SP Coop weapon summoning
item.author: invalid@example.com (Ironword300)
item.dc:creator: Ironword300
item.content:encoded:
This is a question for folks familiar with the UT mod Infltration. I've decided to play unreal SP all the way through with INF weapons (coop). Whenever I come to an unreal weapon, I will ignore it and instead summon an infiltration equivalent; same with ammo. After lots of time spent using the console command "obj list", I have managed to locate most of the requisite weapon codes; but some don't seem to show up in the console, especially weapons with attachments. For example, although I can...

Inf SP Coop weapon summoning

item.title: Ideas for Posting
item.author: invalid@example.com (Sir_Brizz)
item.dc:creator: Sir_Brizz
item.content:encoded:
Please keep conversation sane and rational. Personal attacks, as usual, will not be tolerated. As Epic will be reading ideas from this forum, please make sure to keep your thread titles concise and clear, and perhaps relevant to the discussion you want to have.

Also, several of us have UE4 subs and there is no NDA or anything else on it. If you would like to know how something looks or works, let us know and I'm sure someone can explain it to you or post a screenshot or video for you....

Ideas for Posting

item.title: Putting the Unreal Back in Tournament
item.author: invalid@example.com (Arnox)
item.dc:creator: Arnox
item.content:encoded:
I'd like to talk about the overall themes of UT now. After the first UT, I've noticed things have been getting less and less... Well, fantasyish and surreal. With UT2003/4, things really started to get rather techy. UT3 was kind of odd because Epic apparently was going through their "dark and gritty" phase. Either way though, it still really had a sci-fi theme to it. Once we got to UT3, it seemed like all elements of fantasy and wonder and surrealism kind of... Vanished from the series.

So,...

Putting the Unreal Back in Tournament

item.title: House of Hermskii {HOH} forum update...
item.author: invalid@example.com (Hermskii)
item.dc:creator: Hermskii
item.content:encoded:
I changed my web host a few times and because the "F" in forum is no longer capitalized the old links to the (HOH) forum are broken. The forum is actually up and has been up the whole time. The new and fully functional link is:

http://hermskii.com/forum/index.php

Sorry for any confusion and I'm glad to see everyone here is fine and this forum is still rocking!

Happy New Year and Frag on!

item.title: Command line for dedicated sever?
item.author: invalid@example.com (neokeelo)
item.dc:creator: neokeelo
item.content:encoded:
Can anyone post an example of what I would need to type in the console to host a dedicated server in the new build?

I just want to host a death match or team death match on DM-Lea and Outpost. It's fine if the maps cycle to others as well. Whatever a standard frag limit and time limit should be is fine.

I would appreciate it.

Thanks.

item.title: Unreal Tournament Videos
item.author: invalid@example.com (BigSpeck)
item.dc:creator: BigSpeck
item.content:encoded: Thought I'd make a thread to share cool Unreal videos you've either made or come across.

item.title: Shockrifle time to combo is far too long
item.author: invalid@example.com (ZeaLitY)
item.dc:creator: ZeaLitY
item.content:encoded:
This game has the longest enforced wait for a combo out of every UT game. What I mean by that is, from the moment you launch a shock ball with secondary fire, to the moment you press primary fire to trigger the combo, there is a lag period while your gun resets to default firing position. UT3's was a little on the slower side, in keeping with the befuddling shockrifle nerfs that happened from UT2003 onward.

After playing UT4, the lag just completely nullifies the point of the shockrifle...

Shockrifle time to combo is far too long

item.title: Maintaining the mods
item.author: invalid@example.com (Blade_hunter)
item.dc:creator: Blade_hunter
item.content:encoded:
I believe modding and its maintenance is a whole community effort
Also maintaining the downloads alive is too.
Certain mods are impossible to find or extremely hard.
If it wasn't for certain sites like moddb, or UTzone or even community efforts like http://www.ut-files.com/ and http://unrealtournament.99.free.fr most of the mods would have disappeared into the ashes for good.

The fact that BU doesn't have any hosting since a while was quite a pain as its gamefront...

Maintaining the mods

item.title: UT2004 how to network play? Help please.
item.author: invalid@example.com (G-PLEC)
item.dc:creator: G-PLEC
item.content:encoded:
Hi,
Its been years siince I played any kind of gaming and so have now dug out my UT2K4 and have a friend who has their version on a laptop.

I've looked for 2 days now but can't find a guide of how I can setup the 2 games so we can play each other directly through my home WiFi.

I'm useless at this kind of stuff and have no idea if I need to open a port on my router, or how to setup the game to play direct through my home network - or even if it can be done?

I'd appreciate any help if you...

UT2004 how to network play? Help please.
